opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class MappingReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.FilterReader
          opennlp.ccg.alignment.MappingReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Readable
public class MappingReader
extends FilterReader

Class for reading Mappings from an underlying reader based on a specified MappingFormat.

Instances of this class read mappings group by group, with nextGroup() called after reading the correct number of mappings for the current group, as signaled by the canRead() method.

The following code fragment illustrates the usage of this class: 

 MappingReader reader = ...;
 
 MappingGroup g;
 while((g = reader.getNextGroup()) != null) {
        while(reader.canRead()) {
                Mapping m = reader.readMapping();
                ...
        }
 }

Author:
Scott Martin
See Also:
MappingFormat

Constructor Detail

MappingReader

public MappingReader(Reader r,
                     MappingFormat format)
Creates a mapping reader.

Parameters:
r - The underlying reader.
format - The mapping format to use for reading Mappings.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if format is null.
Method Detail

getFormat

public MappingFormat getFormat()
Returns:
The format used to read mappings.

nextGroup

public MappingGroup nextGroup()
                       throws IOException
Starts reading from the next mapping group.

Returns:
The next MappingGroup found by reading from the underlying reader.
Throws:
IOException - If a ParseException is encountered when calling MappingFormat.parseMapping(String) based on the underlying input, or if one is thrown by the underlying reader. An IOException is also thrown if the number of mappings in the current group could not be read.

canRead

public boolean canRead()
Tests whether mappings can be read from this reader without throwing an IOException.

Returns:
true If there is a current mapping group and mappings remain to be read from it.
See Also:
nextGroup(), readMapping()

readMapping

public Mapping readMapping()
                    throws IOException
Reads a mapping from the underlying reader, if one is available.

Returns:
A mapping formatted by the format in effect.
Throws:
IOException - If no mappings are available in the current group.
